resources.content: What gives me energy?
What is exhausting me?
What vampirises me?
How am I feeling right now?
What would I do that brings me joy if I were living in a world with nobody?
Would people care in this world? If they don’t, why do I waste my time?
What is something you haven’t been honest about with yourself?
Who are you now, and who did you think you’d be? How does the gap between these two versions of yourself make you feel?
What are my non negotiable?
What makes me feel uncomfortable and drained?
A person who has no purpose will fill their lives with pleasure
What makes me feel excited to get up in the morning?
What am I afraid of?
What do I need to stop doing and start doing?
What do I need to let go of from the past?
What are my top three strengths? What are three things I can improve on?
I am proud of myself for ___.
What do I have now that I dreamed of having years ago?
Am I holding onto something that is hurting me more than helping?
Do I believe I am beautiful and worthy of love? If not, where did I learn that from?
A cluttered or messy environment can represent a cluttered mind. What is one thing I can do right now to make my environment cleaner/more organized?
What is one thing I can do today to get closer to my goal?
What do I want my life to look like in five or ten years?
What is/are your greatest strength/s?
Do you have a routine, or are you a person who hates routine?
What does success mean to you?
How have you grown this year? And what have you learned?
We are all unique individuals. What makes you uniquely you?
How do you define success? What do you consider your greatest personal success?
How are you feeling right now? Physically, mentally, spiritually, and socially?
Is anything causing you stress at the moment? Explore what you can do to decrease it.
How do you maintain balance in your life? Are there any changes you need to make in your life?
When you are feeling down, what picks you up?
How do you look after your mental health?
Are you addicted to social media? Assess yourself honestly and explore how it impacts your life and what changes you can make.
How do you look after your physical health?
Write about five things you are grateful for this week. In addition, you can write a monthly, quarterly and yearly gratitude list!
What is something that has impacted positively on your life?
List five things you love about your home.
What brings you joy?
Name three things you couldn’t live without.
What friends are you most grateful for? List what makes each friend so special.
What is the best advice someone has ever given you? Furthermore, what impact did this have on your life?
I feel amazing when …
What are four little things that make you happy, i.e. coffee in the morning, hugs, puppies, and a good book?
If you could have a superpower, what would it be?
What makes you laugh out loud?
List ten things that make you smile
What was the funniest thing you saw or heard this week?
“The most effective way to do it, is to do it.”
resources.author: Amelia Earhart

resources.content: “I am not a product of my circumstances. I am a product of my decisions.”
resources.author: Stephen Covey

resources.content: “You can have results or excuses. Not both.”
resources.author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

resources.content: “You always have two choices: your commitment versus your fear.”
resources.author: Sammy Davis Jr

resources.content: “We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, therefore, is not an act. But a habit.”
resources.author: Aristotle

resources.content: “The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.”
resources.author: Lao Tzu

resources.content: “Think of many things, do one.”
resources.author: Portuguese proverb

resources.content: “Work harder on you than everyone else and you will become unusually successful.”
resources.author: Dani Johnson

resources.content: “Quality means doing it right when no one is looking.”
resources.author: Henry Ford

resources.content: “It’s our choices…that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.”
resources.author: J. K. Rowling

resources.content: “The only day to discover the limits of the possible is to go beyond them into the impossible”
resources.author: Arthur C. Clarke

resources.content: “Success isn’t always about greatness. It’s about consistency. Consistent hard work leads to success. Greatness will come.”
resources.author: Dwayne Johnson

resources.content: “Everything you can imagine is real.”
resources.author: Pablo Picasso

resources.content: “You only get one chance at life and you have to grab it boldly.”
resources.author: Bear Grylls

resources.content: “Remember, no one can make you feel inferior without your consent.”
resources.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

resources.content: “I can’t understand why people are frightened of new ideas. I’m frightened of the old ones.”
resources.author: John Cage

resources.content: “Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.”
resources.author: Confucius

resources.content: “Live, love, laugh, leave a legacy.”
resources.author: Stephen Covey

resources.content: “Always deliver more than expected.”
resources.author: Larry Page

resources.content: “When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.”
resources.author: Elon Musk

resources.content: “Continuous improvement is better than delayed perfection.”
resources.author: Mark Twain

resources.content: “Give me six hours to chop down a tree and I will spend the first four sharpening the axe. “
resources.author: Abraham Lincoln

resources.content: “Chains of habit are too light to be felt until they are too heavy to be broken.”
resources.author: Warren Buffett

resources.content: “You will never change your life until you change something you do daily. The secret of your success is found in your daily routine.”
resources.author: John C. Maxwell

resources.content: “Define success on your own terms, achieve it by your own rules, and build a life you’re proud to live.”
resources.author: Anne Sweeney

resources.content: “You can do anything, but not everything. Prioritize better.”
resources.author: David Allen

resources.content: “Progress has little to do with speed, but much to do with direction.”
resources.author: Timber Hawkeye

resources.content: “Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.”
resources.author: Arthur Ashe

resources.content: “You have the power on your mind, not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.”
resources.author: Marcus Aurelius

resources.content: “Setting goals is the first step in turning the invisible into visible.”
resources.author: Tony Robbins

resources.content: “If a mind thinks with a believing attitude, one can do amazing things.”
resources.author: Norman Vincent Peale

resources.content: “Eighty percent of success is showing up.’”
resources.author: Woody Allen

resources.content: “Your goal should be just out of reach. But not out of sight.”
resources.author: Remi Witt

resources.content: “You must want to be a butterfly so badly, you are willing to give up being a caterpillar.”
resources.author: Trina Paulus

resources.content: “The most common way people give up their power is by thinking they don’t have any.”
resources.author: Alice Walker

resources.content: “I think the thing to do is enjoy the ride while you’re on it.”
resources.author: Johnny Depp

resources.content: “Be willing to be a beginner every single morning.”
resources.author: Meister Eckhart

resources.content: “Abandon anything about your life and habits that might be holding you back. Learn to create your own opportunities.”
resources.author: Sophia Amoruso

resources.content: “How you climb a mountain is more important than reaching the top.”
resources.author: Yvon Chouinard

resources.content: “Do the best you can until you know better. Then when you know better, do better.”
resources.author: Maya Angelou

resources.content: “Someday is not a day of the week.”
resources.author: Janet Dailey

resources.content: “What we fear doing most is usually what we most need to do.”
resources.author: Tim Ferriss

resources.content: “Do or do not. There is no try.”
resources.author: Yoda

resources.content: “Fall seven times, stand up eight.”
resources.author: Japanese proverb

resources.content: “Simplicity boils down to two steps: Identify the essential. Eliminate the rest.”
resources.author: Leo Babauta

resources.content: “Don’t lament so much about how your career is going to turn out. You don’t have a career. You have a life.”
resources.author: Cheryl Strayed

resources.content: “If your actions inspire others to dream more, learn more, do more and become more, you are a leader.”
resources.author: John Quincy Adams

resources.content: “A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.”
resources.author: Ayn Rand

resources.content: “To succeed in your mission, you must have single-minded devotion to your goal.”
resources.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

resources.content: “Someone, at some point, came up with this very bad idea that an ordinary individual couldn’t make a difference in the world. I think that’s just a horrible thing.”
resources.author: John Skoll
